Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2013 01:28PM Moondaiseez wrote: Ugh. Why is it that this stuff is so terrifying, even when statistically the odds are in my favor that there still won't be anything? Sigh.
Posts.Title: 6 month update Moondaiseez Moondaiseez

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2013 12:27PM Moondaiseez wrote: Thanks Beesie. We're doing another ultrasound today just to be thorough and then if that is normal I can wait 3 more months for the next re-check. At which point we call in a surgeon for a consult if the discharge is still clear and still happening. Sounds like the left side is most likely fibrocystic, the right side is still questionable. Could be a papilloma, could be cancer, could be just one of those things. So time will tell I suppose.
Posts.Title: 6 month update Moondaiseez Moondaiseez

Posts.Content: Moondaiseez wrote: On Thursday I go back to the Mayo clinic for my 6 month follow up visit. No cancer so far. No actual explanation for 8.5 months of off and on clear single duct discharge, but no cancer. So as the impending checkup reminds me of last winter's scare I felt the urge to check back in with you all too. In the last three weeks my other breast has started leaking from a single duct as well- but a milky non cancer looking fluid so I don't know if that will complicate or make diagnosis easier. Anyway- still trying to enjoy each day I am cancer free until someone proves it otherwise and wanted to share. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 6 month update Moondaiseez Moondaiseez

Posts.Content: Moondaiseez wrote: My mayo clinic appointment is on Friday and I can't get the nipple discharge to happen on command today. Making me feel crazy even though it was coming out on its own as recently as just a few days ago. I debated canceling and just believing the doctor that it isn't cancer because in his 20 years practicing he's never botched a ductogram on a woman who ended up with cancer. But I have a lump on my neck- my googling tells me it is probably a swollen supraclavicular lymph node. It's been there about 6 weeks. I also have what feels like sand or a small uncooked grain of rice that appeared in the last few weeks in my armpit area. Also there is a shiny spot on my skin in a different area of the breast and a very thin tiny red crooked line has appeared over the spot with the hard sandy feeling. I have intermittent pain in various spots. And today my husband's co-worker lost his girlfriend to cancer. She was diagnosed yesterday and today she died. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Freaking out Moondaiseez Moondaiseez

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2013 06:09PM Moondaiseez wrote: I know. I know. I was so good for the month before the botched ductogram- didn't try to squeeze it at all so it would be there when needed. But then the doc punctured the duct and that killed that. I couldn't express it the first two times I went to the doctor and I feel like it just confirmed for them that I was worried about nothing. But something is wrong with me and I need answers. Is it Friday yet?

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2012 07:39PM Moondaiseez wrote: I have not much of use to share - i am in the diagnostic phase of what will hopefully turn out to be nothing serious, but as you haven't gotten a response yet, I figured I would bump your post. My practitioners have frequently referred to my breasts as nodular for what that is worth. From reading other responses on here, you have a right to request the images from your US or mammogram and get a second opinion if you aren't satisfied with your answers.
Posts.Title: Confused, frustrated and scared melissamyers99 Moondaiseez

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2013 03:56PM Moondaiseez wrote: I am new to this too so dont take my word for it, but a BIRADS 3 is good. It means something was found and doesn't appear to be cancer. Your report sounds like they identified cysts which are fluid filled and not cancerous. So others here will be able to tell you more- but I think the report says you are ok.
Posts.Title: New to all this...... soclueless1 soclueless1

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2013 12:55PM Moondaiseez wrote: Hi Sarah71, I am sorry you are going through this. I think the biggest benefit of this site is not feeling so alone in all of this. I am certainly not a medical expert and am trying to navigate my own nipple discharge scenario- but in general most nipple discharge is caused by benign conditions- including bloody discharge which gets the most attention. If this is your first mammogram then make sure not to wear lotions or deodorant and dress comfortably as you'll only have to undress from the waist up. Let us know what you find out. I am going in for a ductogram tomorrow as my mammogram and ultrasound did not uncover the cause of the discharge so I will think of you and wish you good benign results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Moondaiseez wrote: Hello ladies, march 1 I had a second mammogram and ultrasound at mayo because of my clear nipple discharge in one duct on one breast. All tests negative. So I stopped worrying as much (especially as they found other more minor things wrong with me). Fast forward to last Thursday and for the first time I found yellow stains in my bra at the end of the day. I clearly still have it, and now it has changed from clear to clear with a yellow hue. Does this warrant an extra call to the doctor? My two month follow up is April 25th. They told me to call if it turned bloody- but yellow? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: To call or not to call Moondaiseez Minderella

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2013 02:18PM Moondaiseez wrote: For sure get it checked out. A papilloma is the most likely cause of bloody or rust colored discharge- which is just like a tiny wart that grows inside a duct but there are other causes too sinister and no big deal and you want your doctor to rule out the scary stuff. Bumps at the edge of the areola where hair follicles grow are totally normal.
Posts.Title: Nipple discharge emanderson Momcat1962

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2013 08:35PM Moondaiseez wrote: I am glad you are getting to the bottom of this - and so sorry they think it is IBC. Hugs to you. And courage and strength too.
Posts.Title: Help!!! Will I ever get to the bottom of this?????? busywithfive bevin

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2012 03:45PM Moondaiseez wrote: Try not to worry too much. Nipple discharge is very common, especially in the couple years post breastfeeding. You have odds in your favor because of your age too. I just left my first mammogram/breast ultrasound for discharge in one duct in one breast. They said my images look fine- and they are not very concerned because the discharge only comes when squeezed and is clear- not bloody. I have been instructed to not touch that breast for 30 days and come in for a ductogram only if it is still having discharge. It is good your doctor is being thorough but chances are this is totally normal.
